meanings.definition: Discarded or old items that are considered useless or of little value.
meanings.sent1: I found some old junk in the attic.
meanings.sent2: The garage sale had a lot of junk for sale.
meanings.sent3: My brother's room is full of junk, but he calls it his treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was cluttered with junk thoughts that she needed to clear out.
meanings.sent5: The junk in the backyard made it hard to walk around.

meanings.sent1: Stop talking junk and focus on the task.
meanings.sent2: His speech was full of junk, making it hard to understand.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's junk made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were just junk to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The meeting was unproductive due to all the junk being discussed.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something as trash or unwanted.
meanings.sent1: I need to junk these old clothes.
meanings.sent2: She decided to junk the broken vase.
meanings.sent3: He tried to junk his bad habits but found it challenging.
meanings.sent4: The company had to junk the faulty product to avoid complaints.
meanings.sent5: After the party, they had to junk all the leftover food.
